page.title: 19 An Oxford Man's Memories
page.content: The school that Mr.Twining went to, was in George Street.Schools were much stricter then.Everybody was afraid of the Headmaster.The cane was used often. Every day started with Assembly and Scripture readings.During the day the pupils stayed in their classrooms and the teachers moved for the different lessons. At school Mr. Twining wore a tie, shorts and a brown blazer.When he was older he wore trousers. Buildings have changed a lot since Mr.Twining was a boy.Where the shops in Summertown are, there used to be a row of small cottages.Where St.Gregory's school is, there used to be allotments. Prices have changed too.In the 1920's a Baby Austin could be bought for 100 pounds and petrol was 5p a gallon. Horse-drawn trams travelled up the bumpy roads.
